meanings.sent1: The dog left a pile of poop on the grass.
meanings.sent2: I stepped in some poop on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: The poop in the litter box needed to be cleaned.
meanings.sent4: The seagulls scavenged for food in the poop-filled garbage bin.
meanings.sent5: The smell of poop filled the room, making everyone gag.

meanings.sent1: The baby will poop after eating.
meanings.sent2: I need to poop before we leave the house.
meanings.sent3: The bear decided to poop in the woods.
meanings.sent4: The bird pooped on the car windshield.
meanings.sent5: After holding it in for so long, she finally pooped with relief.

meanings.sent1: Don't listen to his poop, it's all made up.
meanings.sent2: She laughed at the silly poop he was saying.
meanings.sent3: The movie was full of poop, but it was still entertaining.
meanings.sent4: His explanation was pure poop, not making any sense.
meanings.sent5: The teacher dismissed his answer as complete poop.
